steps: Open your browser and go to 192.168.0.1 (or tplinkwifi.net)
Log in with admin credentials (default: admin / admin)
Go to Advanced → Network → DHCP Server
Change Primary DNS to 208.67.222.123 (OpenDNS FamilyShield)
Change Secondary DNS to 208.67.220.123
Click Save and reboot the router
Go to System Tools → Administration → change the admin password
Save the new password in a safe place (give it to someone you trust)
Open your browser and go to 192.168.1.1 (or router.asus.com)
Log in with your admin credentials
Go to WAN → Internet Connection
Set 'Connect to DNS Server automatically' to No
Enter DNS Server 1: 208.67.222.123 (OpenDNS FamilyShield)
Enter DNS Server 2: 208.67.220.123
Click Apply
Go to Administration → System → change the admin password
Save the new password in a safe place (give it to someone you trust)
Open your browser and go to 192.168.1.1 (or routerlogin.net)
Log in (default: admin / password)
Go to Internet (or Basic → Internet)
In the DNS section, select 'Use These DNS Servers'
Primary DNS: 208.67.222.123 (OpenDNS FamilyShield)
Secondary DNS: 208.67.220.123
Click Apply
Go to Advanced → Administration → Set Password
Save the new password in a safe place (give it to someone you trust)
Open your browser and go to 192.168.1.1
Log in with your admin credentials
Go to Setup → Basic Setup (or Connectivity → Internet Settings)
Under DNS, enter Static DNS 1: 208.67.222.123
Click Save Settings
Go to Administration → Management → change the router password
Save the new password in a safe place (give it to someone you trust)
Open your browser and go to 192.168.0.1
Log in (default: admin / blank password)
Go to Setup → Internet Setup → Manual Internet Connection Setup
Primary DNS: 208.67.222.123 (OpenDNS FamilyShield)
Secondary DNS: 208.67.220.123
Click Save Settings
Go to Tools → Admin → change the admin password
Save the new password in a safe place (give it to someone you trust)
Open your browser and go to 192.168.1.1
Log in with your admin credentials
Go to Settings → DHCP → LAN
Change Primary DNS to 208.67.222.123
Change Secondary DNS to 208.67.220.123
Click Save/Apply
Go to System → Change Password
Save the new password in a safe place (give it to someone you trust)
Open your browser and go to 192.168.31.1 (or miwifi.com)
Log in with your admin credentials
Go to Common settings → Internet settings
Change DNS settings to manual
DNS 1: 208.67.222.123 (OpenDNS FamilyShield)
Click Apply
Go to Security → Change admin password
Save the new password in a safe place (give it to someone you trust)
Open your browser and go to 192.168.1.1
Log in (default: admin / admin or user / user)
Go to Network → LAN → DHCP Server
Primary DNS: 208.67.222.123
Secondary DNS: 208.67.220.123
Click Submit/Save
Go to Administration → User Management → change the password
Save the new password in a safe place (give it to someone you trust)
Find your router's IP: open Command Prompt and type 'ipconfig' (look for Default Gateway)
Open that IP in your browser and log in with admin credentials
Look for DNS settings (usually under Internet, WAN, DHCP, or Network settings)
Change Primary DNS to 208.67.222.123 (OpenDNS FamilyShield)
Change Secondary DNS to 208.67.220.123
Save and reboot the router
Find the admin password setting and change it to something strong
Save the new password in a safe place (give it to someone you trust)
